titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chit Chat Club Records, 1877-2010 M0158
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Williams

publicationstmt.publisher: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-07-15T14:10-0700

change.item: March 23, 2004: converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl

did.unittitle: Chit Chat Club Records

repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Chit Chat Club was founded in 1874 in San Francisco. It is a private essay club whose 25 members meet the second Monday of each month to hear and discuss an essay written by one of its members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records of the Chit Chat Club of San Francisco including correspondence, essays, biographical, administrative and related material.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Chit Chat Club Records, M0158, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of San Francisco Literary Club, 1966, and the Chit Chat Club, 1984, 1985, 1986, 1991, 1995, 1997, 2002, 2003, 2005, 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials housed in blue-green slip case. Contents include invitations, annual dinner programs, and Ten Years of Chit Chat 1885-1895 (bound volume).

Contents of Ten Years of Chit Chat 1885-1895 include Report of the 11th Annual Dinner, Nov. 9 1885 -- Grant and Ward (â€œorationâ€), Samuel B. Wiggins, Nov. 9 1885 -- The Silver Question (oration, 12th Ann. Dinner), A.R. Briggs, Nov.15 1886 -- Freedom (oration, 13th Ann. Dinner), F.B. Perkins, Nov. 14 1887 -- The Prospect of Universal Freedom (resp.to toast), General Howard, Nov. 14 1887 -- War (response to toast), Rev. Dr. Stebbins, Nov. 14 1887 -- Literature (response to toast), Charles Murdock, Nov. 14 1887 -- The Press (response to toast), John P. Irish, Nov. 14 1887 -- All The Worldâ€™s A Stage (response to toast), Peter Robertson, Nov. 14 1887 -- Public Office And Public Trust (resp. to toast), Col. Stuart Taylor, Nov. 14 1887 -- The United States: A Nation Among Nations (oration, 15th Ann. Dinner), F.P. Deering, Nov. 11 1889 -- Literature of the Year (response to toast), Chas. A. Murdock, Nov. 11 1889 -- Recent Tendencies In Modern Religious Thought (response to toast), Rev. Jacob Voorsanger, Nov. 11 1889 -- Pension Legislation As Affecting Morals And Finance (response to toast), Willard B. Harrington, Nov. 11 1889 -- Medieval And Modern Professors (resp. to toast), Prof. Bernard Moses -- The Future Of Alaska (response to toast), Louis Sloss, Jr. -- American Character And Characteristics (oration, 16th Ann. Dinner), Wm. Greer Harrison, Nov.? 1890 -- Practical Reform (response to toast), Rev. George Montgomery, Nov.? 1890 -- The Regular Army Of The US (response to toast), Gen. John Gibbons, Nov.? 1890 -- The Worldâ€™s Columbian Exposition of 1893 (oration, 17th Ann. Dinner), Joseph D. Phelan, Nov. 9 1891 -- Opportunity (â€œpoem of the eveningâ€ for 18th Ann. Dinner), Chas. Howard Shinn, Nov. 9 1891 -- The Discovery Of America (oration, 18th Ann. Dinner), Frank P. Deering, Nov. 9 1892 -- The Effect Of The Discovery Of America Upon The Growth Of Natural Science (resp. to toast), Pres. (Stanford) David S. Jordan, Nov. 9 1892 -- The Effect Of The Discovery Of America Upon The Growth Of Political Science (resp. to toast), Prof. Bernard Moses, Nov. 9 1892 -- The Effect Of The Discovery Of America Upon The Growth Of Religion (resp. to toast), Rev. W.W. Thoburn, Nov. 9 1892 -- The Effect Of The Discovery Of America Upon The Growth Of American Literature (resp. to toast), John Vance Cheney, Nov. 9 1892 -- New Worlds In Time (response to toast), Joseph LeConte, Nov. 9 1892 -- American Social Problems (response to toast), Prof. J.M. Stillman, Nov. 9 1892 -- The Political Significance Of The Year 1893 (oration, 19th Ann. Dinner), Willard B. Harrington, Nov. 13 1893 -- Achievements Of 1893 In International Relations (response to toast), Pres. (UCB) Kellogg, Nov. 13 1893 -- The Parliament Of Religions, 1893 (resp. to toast), Horatio Stebbins, Nov. 13 1893 -- Changing Society (oration, 20th Ann. Dinner), Alfred Holman, Nov. 12 1894 -- Conservation of Energy (response to toast), Joseph LeConte, Nov. 12 1894 -- A New Saving Factor In Society (resp. to toast), Nathan Abbott, Nov. 12 1894 -- Signs - Political (response to toast), James Phelan, Nov. 12 1894 -- Distribution Of Wealth Statute (resp. to toast), Thomas R. Bacon, Nov. 12 1894 -- Signs â€“ Good Or Bad? (response to toast), Hon. John Hunt, Nov. 12 1894 -- Merchants (response to toast), Willard B Harrington, Nov. 12 1894 -- Can the Public Protect Itself Against Strikes? (response to toast), Prof. O.L. Elliott, Nov. 12 1894 -- 20 Years Of The Chit Chat Club (resp. to toast), Gen. Thomas H Ruper, Nov. 12 1894 -- The Monroe Doctrine (printed, unbound essay), A.F. Morrison, Dec. 9 1896

did.unittitle: Ten Years of Chit-Chat,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Small bound volume. Contents include: Progress of intellectual development and the emancipation of human thought (response), Rev. Dr. Stebbins, Nov. 12, 1877 -- Science - The Modern Magician (response to toast), Prof. Joseph LeConte, Nov. 12, 1877 -- Liberty, Not License (oration), George W. Haight, Nov. 11, 1878 -- On Literature (response to toast), Charles H. Phelps, Nov. 11, 1878 -- Responses to â€œtoastsâ€ on horticulture, the press, and higher education, Nov.11, 1878 -- Shelley and the Revolution (oration), Hosiah Royce, Nov. 10, 1879 -- On Literature (response), F. P. Deering, Nov. 10, 1879 -- Responses to toasts on Unity of Law; The Army of Science; Materialism/Idealism, Rev. Dr. Platt and Prof. Davidson, Nov. 10, 1879 -- Influence of Science on Modern Thought, John M. Stillman, Nov. 22, 1880 -- On Literature, Charles H. Shinn, Nov. 22, 1880 -- Equality, Joseph Hutchinson, Nov. 14, 1881 -- Poem for the evening: Life Thoughts, Charles H. Shinn, Nov. 14, 1881 -- On Literature, (response to toast), Samuel B. Wiggin, Nov. 14, 1881 -- On Political Economy, (response to toast), F.W.Tompkins, Nov. 14, 1881 -- On Science, (response to toast), Prof. Joseph LeConte, Nov. 14, 1881 -- Maritime Commerce of the Pacific States, (response to toast), William Merry, Nov. 14, 1881 -- The Judiciary, (response to toast), D.P. Evans, Nov. 14, 1881 -- Industries of the Pacific Slope, (response to toast), Irving M. Scott, Nov. 14, 1881 -- Intellectual Culture, (oration), Gordon B. Landing, Nov. 13, 1882 -- Poem of the evening, Samuel B. Wiggin, Nov. 13, 1882 -- On Literature, (response to toast), W.M. Van Dyke, Nov. 13, 1882 -- The Political Economy of Adam Smith, (response to toast), John C. Hall, Nov. 13, 1882 -- The Judiciary, (response to toast), Judge E. W. McKinstry, Nov. 13, 1882 -- The University of California, (response to toast), President W.F. Reed, Nov. 13, 1882 -- Medical Literature, (response to toast), Washington Ayer, M.D., Nov. 13, 1882 -- The Chit-Chat Club, (response to toast), F. P. Deering, Nov. 11, 1883 -- Presidential Address, George W. Haight, Nov. 10, 1884 -- On the Chit-Chat Club (oration), Charles A. Murdock, Nov. 10, 1884 -- On Literature (response to toast), F. B. Perkins, Nov. 10, 1884 -- On Political Economy (response to toast), Thomas F. Barry, Nov. 10, 1884 -- On Our State University (response to toast), Prof. George H. Howison, Nov. 10, 1884 -- On Justice (response to toast), Hon. John Hunt, Jr., Nov. 10, 1884 -- On Our National Legislature (response to toast), Hon. W.W. Morrow, Nov. 10, 1884

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials housed in brown and green slip case include printed pamphlets 1895-1954 including proceedings, programs and menus of annual dinners (not complete), memorials, summaries of activities and reprints.
